definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
"fire" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 86), occurring in 熙, 然, 熊 etc
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
Michael Schumacher (1969-), former German racing driver
Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
variant of 馬德里|马德里[Ma3 de2 li3], Madrid

sentences.english: Father Mabeuf was one of those persons for whom plants have souls.
sentences.chinese: 和某些人一樣，馬白夫公公也認爲植物是有靈魂的。

sentences.english: Horses should be walked for a while after a race.
sentences.chinese: 比賽後，應讓馬慢走一會兒。

sentences.english: He rode on, blood flowing from his side.
sentences.chinese: 他騎滅馬，陳血從腰部流上去。

sentences.english: Too much bone in their skulls.
sentences.chinese: 馬的頭蓋上，骨頭太多了。

sentences.english: The horse's strides are shorter than at the other canters, without losing elasticity and cadence.
sentences.chinese: 馬的步幅比其他幾種跑步較短，但卻不失彈性與節奏。

sentences.english: The salt pans at Maras, in use since pre-Inca days.
sentences.chinese: 在馬拉什的鹽田，在自前印加天使用。

sentences.english: Lafuma added a rubber toe strip to protect you from rocks and roots.
sentences.chinese: 拉弗馬增加了橡膠腳趾地帶，以保護您的岩石和根源。

sentences.english: Over the mountains, and under the sky-riding dirty grey horses, go you and I.
sentences.chinese: 在山區，天空下騎骯髒的灰色馬，去你和我。

sentences.english: Despite the clouds, the Matterhorn still was a great piece of rock to look at.
sentences.chinese: 除了雲朵外，馬特宏峯看上去始終是塊壯觀的石頭。

sentences.english: The rampant and absurd behavior that prince 2 for people unprepared.
sentences.chinese: 這猖獗而荒唐的行爲叫馬王二人一時措手不及。

sentences.english: The Hong Kong racing season could be extended from as early as summer next year.
sentences.chinese: 香港馬季最快可於下年年中延長。

sentences.english: He swam his horse across the river .
sentences.chinese: 他使自己的馬遊過那條河。

sentences.english: Some time afterwards, M. Madeleine was appointed mayor.
sentences.chinese: 過些日子，馬德蘭先生被任命爲市長。

sentences.english: Thenceforth, M. Madeleine was transfigured in Fantine's eyes.
sentences.chinese: 從此馬德蘭先生在芳汀的心目中是另外一個人了。

sentences.english: She eventually chose a photographer as her date on the show.
sentences.chinese: 最終，馬諾在節目裏選擇了一名攝影師約會。

sentences.english: It was dusk when the hunter drove into the barn and unhitched his horse.
sentences.chinese: 當獵人駕駛入穀倉並且放鬆了他的馬，它是黃昏。

definition: (bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent
pertaining to/concerning/with regard to/about/a matter of
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
